data.title: The alphabetical
data.solution:
s = input()
blank_number = order_number = 0
check = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
for i in range(26):
    if s[i] == " ":
        blank_number += 1
        order_number += i + 1
print(blank_number, order_number, sep = '\n')
data.statement:
There is an alphabetically ordered string of 26 characters from letters A to Z.
In the 26-character string, zero or more characters are replaced by spaces.
Please output the total number of characters that are space and the total number of alphabetical order of the characters that are space.

The counting order of the strings in "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" is "A = 1, B = 2, C = 3, and so on up to Z = 26".

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn: AB DEFGHI KL NO  RSTU WXYZ

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: ABC EFG IJK MNO QRS UVW YZ

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: B DE GHIJ  MNOP R TU WX Z

data.constraints:
The number of characters entered is 26, including spaces.
Alphabetic characters entered are always uppercase.
A space in place of an alphabet is represented by a single-byte space.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> Number of alphabetic characters replaced by spaces in the string.
<<Line 2 :>> Alphabetical sum of alphabetic characters replaced by spaces.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There is an alphabetically ordered string of 26 characters from letters A to Z.
In the 26-character string, zero or more characters are replaced by spaces.
Please output the total number of characters that are space and the total number of alphabetical order of the characters that are space.

The counting order of the strings in "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" is "A = 1, B = 2, C = 3, and so on up to Z = 26".
Input
Line 1: A String s
Output
Line 1 : Number of alphabetic characters replaced by spaces in the string.
Line 2 : Alphabetical sum of alphabetic characters replaced by spaces.
Constraints
The number of characters entered is 26, including spaces.
Alphabetic characters entered are always uppercase.
A space in place of an alphabet is represented by a single-byte space.
Example
Input
 BCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
Output
1
1
